intro: Schmidelia macrophylla, commonly known as the giant Schmidelia, is a striking member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its large, compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves can grow up to 30 centimeters in length, making it one of the largest leafy plants in its genus. The flowers are typically arranged in umbels, and the plant is often found in shaded, forested areas. Schmidelia macrophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
